headline: Caramel Pecan Pie
description: This caramel pecan pie is a twist on the standard holiday classic! Buttery caramel candies are melted and mixed in with the pecan filling... delicious!

video.description: See how to make a nutty, buttery pie with a sweet touch of chewy caramel.
video.name: Caramel Pecan Pie

name: Caramel Pecan Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.)
Combine caramels, butter, and milk in a saucepan over low heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until caramels are melted and mixture is smooth, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.
Mix together sugar, eggs, vanilla, and salt in a large bowl. Gradually mix in the melted caramel mixture, then stir in pecans. Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is golden brown, 45 to 50 minutes. Remove from the oven and let set on a wire rack until filling is firm, about 15 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

review.reviewBody: This is an easy and delicious pie. I have made it several times.

This was delicious. I made it as written but after doing so I would agree with those reviewers who said to reduce sugar to 1/2 cup. It was difficult to cut through the halved pecans so the next time I will try using chopped pecans. The halved pecans look beautiful though and I am not sure how the chopped ones will affect the look. It would be nice to see a picture of someone who used chopped pecans. I will definitely use this recipe again. I made my own crust Butter Flaky Pie Crust for allrecipe. I like the idea that there is no Karo Syrup in this recipe.
Fantastic! Best pecan pie I’ve had! I couldn’t find regular caramels at our store so I used Werthers chewy caramels instead and it was delicious!
My staple pie for the holidays. Best pie!

Using caramel instead of Karo syrup is brilliant. I've been making this recipe from this site for over 10 years, I get RAVING reviews every time. Now, any time I try a Karo Syrup pecan pie I am SO disappointed that it's not the same taste! I follow the instructions to the T and every time it's been amazingly delicious.
I think adding the caramels is a wonderful idea. When I make this I will omit the milk and white sugar, using a cup of Karo syrup. I have never made a pecan pie without Karo.
This is Lasca and Dub’s fav. If making pie crust or using my dishes, increase the filling. The original is about a quarter off. Try 12 servings next time and cook until it jiggles
HANDS DOWN best pecan pie you have ever had. I make two for Thanksgiving and they're all gone and maybe half the pumpkin pie is left
I made this and it was easy, looked and tasted great!

It is wonderful recipe for pecan Pie. 
 I love it.
Everybody loves this pie! I use werthers soft Carmel’s and a half cup of sugar and crushed pecans in a graham crust or Oreo crust pie!!
I made this with homemade caramel sauce (about 11 oz) and it was amazing. Had to give half of the pie away or I would've eaten the whole thing.

I made this without changes. The flavor was outstanding. The best pecan pie I've ever tasted. I did decrease the sugar as others have suggested and it wasn't to sweet. I gave it 4 stars because I didn't like the texture of the filling. It was more like pumpkin pie. Next time I will try it with the ice-cream topping.

Thank you - This was a ridiculously easy recipe. I was able to make this the night before. I added an 1/8th tsp of orange extract to the filling and it was nicely flavored. It not only looks nice but tastes great too. Perfect for beginners at pie making.
i loved it!!! i even added a few little designs on top with pie dough! delish!

I love pecan pie but the traditional corn syrup version is just too sweet. I found this recipe on all recipes many years ago and have been making it ever since. It’s absolutely DELICIOUS! The caramel is sweet enough but not so sweet that the pecans can’t be the star. I haven’t subbed out the candies for the ice cream topping caramel but based on other reviews it may be worth it if you’re short on time. I don’t mind so I melt a good caramel candy brand. try it.... you will LOVE IT!

I made this last night exactly how the recipe calls. It was absolutely amazing. A little dab of vanilla ice cream on the top was the only thing I added. A piece out of the fridge goes very well with a morning coffee, too. This is the first pie I’ve ever attempted and it couldn’t have been easier, other than being a little tedious unwrapping all the little caramel pieces.

No changes - have made it many times.
My grandsons absolutely love this pie.

Oh. My. Goodness! Followed this recipe to a tee. I've tried several pecan custard reciped that went straight from the oven to the compost. 
This pie is too pretty to cut although I did gently move a top pecan over and stole a spoon ful to taste. Delicious little pieces of pecan throughout, lovely melt in your mouth flavor.
The mix is super loose going into the pie shell but don't worry. It comes together beautifully after 40 minutes. Will jiggle when coming out of the oven.LET IT SIT. LET IT SIT 
A couple of hours at least until it thickens...yummy!
I made this for my son in law for Christmas 2019, needless to say, HE LOVED IT. All I did differently was to add more pecans 1 and 1/2 cups pecans.
It's delicious best pie I've had.make it every year

I made this last night. it is really good. The pecan flavor comes through very nicely and I made it less sweet than it calls for. I used 40 of the individually wrapped Kraft camels. The result was not a huge carmel flavor, but good. I think next time, I will see if I can find better carmels with a stronger carmel flavor. The recipe calls for 3/4 cup of white sugar, but I strongly recommend you trying less than this. I used 1/4 cup and it was plenty sweet for me. Sweetness is a tough one though as everyone likes different levels of sweetness. The main thing to keep in mind here is that its easy to add sugar after the pie is done, if you find its not sweet enough for your taste. You can always add some powdered sugar on top. But its impossible to make the pie less sweet once the sugar as already been made. So best to add less sugar and add more if needed. Its also hard to find a good pre-made store bought crust, so I always recommend making your own. This recipe is a keeper to be sure.
Very chewy and delicious! It didn’t come out as pretty as the picture, but it was wonderful tasting. I used a graham cracker crust instead and it worked great!
My family of caramel lovers did not like it at all - and my mom and I love pecan pie too but just thought it was barely ok. Just not to our taste.
I only used 1/4 cup sugar and it turned out perfect. I will definitely make it again.
added to my Thanksgiving " favorites" list!

This is so delicious! I don’t like the proportion of regular pecan pie (filling vs. pecans), but the extra thickness of the filling here suspends the pecans and makes it a nicer texture. And the flavor is amazing!

Wish I had taken a photo of this pie before it was devoured. This recipe turned out perfect.It wasn’t runny like a few people have said. The only thing I did was add maybe 2 less caramels than it called for but that was because I ate them. Everybody raves about this pie. Absolutely the best.
I used a half cup of brown sugar instead of .75 cups of white

I made this pie! it is fantastic! I altered the recipe a little. I used about 44 caramels & 3 cups pecans. It fit perfectly into a deep dish pie crust.
A hack I used in mixing the Carmel mixture into the eggs and sugar: I set the pot into cold water in the sink until the mix was WARM to the touch. I then poured about 3/4 into egg mixture to temper it. Once I mixed that, I poured the egg mixture into my Carmel. it worked brilliantly! 

This is the first "homemade" or "from scratch" pie I've ever made.
It didn't come out as firm as I would have liked. But it was DELICIOUS!
This is now my go to Pecan Pie!! It's not too sweet, and has depth beyond the typical just sweet pecan pie.

I took my pie to church to get the opinion of a baker in our area. She said it was the best pecan pie she’s ever tasted, but I’m not allowed to get a big head over it. Too late. Ha! Thank you for the AMAZING recipe!
Made it and I like the way it turned out taste pretty good too This is the 1st time I ever tried to even bake pecan pie
I have made this several times over the last and everyone says it's the best pecan pie they have ever had and I would have to agree. Fallow the recipe to the letter and you won't be disappointed.
No changes except used a bit of coconut oil in place of butter

This was a very easy recipe. Upon reading reviews I did make a few changes. Used brown sugar instead of white and reduced it to 1/2 cup. Omitted salt (salt in butter). I did use caramel candies (Brachs) which took awhile to melt. Just b sure to melt on low. Other people have suggested using Smuckers caramel topping to lessen the time. I cooked for 40 mins as my oven cooks fast. After 20 mins, I covered edges of crust with foil so it didn't burn. It will be puffy when you take it out. Don't panic. It will settle down as it cools. I also microwaved 6 caramels, pat of butter(1/2 Tbsp) and dash of milk for drizzle on top of pie. This was first time I made it and will make it again.

I added more pecans but everything else in this recipe is spot on. I used a 50/50 mix of brown sugar and white sugar like some of the traditional recipes for pecan pie. 

Pop the bubbles in the mix when you put it in the pie crust before baking. It will puff when you cook it and might look like it's going to crack when you take it out but it will settle as it cools and end up looking beautiful.
Pecan pie is my absolute favorite .....but not everyone. else agrees....perfect compromise. was loved by all.
It turned out great! I used evaporated milk instead of regular milk and it turned out very rich and tasty.
I made 2 of these on Thanksgiving and everyone loved it! I cut back on the sugar a tad. Will def make again.
Our new go-to for pecan pie!

I have been making this for a few years now as it has become a family favorite! I use brownsugar if I have it, and cut it too 1/2 cup- other than that It’s by the book. Thank yout for such a delicious and easy family favorite!
I add in more pecans (almost 2 cups) and split the sugar 50/50 white and brown to give it a more traditionally "pecan pie" flavor.

Best and easiest Pecan pie!
It is now the favorite of 3 separate Thanksgivings
Delicious and easy
Make it just as it is....I could seriously eat the whole pie!
Definitely will make it again.

This was excellent. Used 8 oz of caramel topping like others suggested. I found the consistency to be a little "jelly" like but the longer it was in the fridge the better. It still tasted fantastic. Will make again.
I found this on all recipes.com about 10 years ago and I have been making it ever since. My family LOVES it.
I usually have a hard time with pecan pies being runny. I was more fortunate with this recipe. It was delicious. I use an ice cream caramel drizzle over the top of the slice as well. I love caramel.

I made this and let me say it was a big hit with everyone! If the only downside is unwrapping the caramels, then we are in good shape. I love how consistent this cooks as opposed to some of the 'wetter' versions of Pecan pie. Big fan!

I made this and brought it into the office:) Everyone said they loved it, some even said the best they have ever tasted! The only change I made was to lay the pecans on the top to make it look pretty:/

Everyone that ate this pie raved about how good it was, and I loved it too! I followed a previous suggestion to use the caramel ice cream topping instead of caramels and to cut the sugar to 1/2 cup- and it worked so slick.

I make a pecan pie every year for Thanksgiving along with other pies. I was looking for a little change this year and found this recipe. Not difficult at all....the changes I made were to rough chop the pecans in the mixture then makes a concentric circle of pecan halves on the top. When I say this pie was spectacular, well that's truly an understatement...family said it's a game changer!!!! Unbelievably delicious...everyone raved about it. Thank you for sharing this amazing recipe!!

I wanted to love this recipe. Caramel and pecan pie, two of my favorites combined. I made for Thanksgiving and it was okay, not great but not bad either. Just okay. Followed recipe exactly and didn't have any problems, used a homemade crust. There wasn't anything wrong with the pie, it just didn't "wow" me like I was hoping. Good enough I wasn't embarrassed to serve it, but not good enough to take the place of my regular pecan pie. Really glad I made and tried this recipe but probably won't make again. Thanks for sharing the recipe.

Yummy
I used the Kraft ready to melt balls. The wrapped caramels has about 36 in the bag, the bag of ready to melt balls weighs the same as the wrapped caramels. So I used the entire bag.
 
Per other reviewers, I used 1/2 cup of sugar, Brown sugar. 
I added the brown sugar to the caramel mixture so it would dissolve.
I doubled the pecans and used a deep dish ready made crust.
I cooked it for 10 minutes at 400°. 10 minutes at 350°. Then lightly covered, 30 minutes at 300°. 

It wasn't too sweet or too caramelly (is that a word?)
Next time I might add some chocolate chips. Mmmmmmmm
Will definitely be making again.
I've made this three times so far. The flavor and consistency really improved, in my opinion, when I substituted brown sugar for white.

I had to make my own crust, to avoid a problem that's been plaguing me recently. I accidentally used salted butter in the crust, so it was way, way, way too salty. Haha, it was a surprise for mother's day, so I couldn't ask for guidance on salted or unsalted butter. That is the only qualm I had with my pie, but it had nothing to do with the recipe. The filling was amazing, mom loved it! The caramel was a journey and lesson learned in melting and mixing.
If you have any trouble mixing the caramel, boil a bowl of water and put the bowl containing the mixture and caramel onto the pot, the caramel will melt again in time and it will be easy to stir together, it took me about fifteen, twenty minutes. Once it was melted together, it was all good.
So, melting and mixing was a little challenging for the beginner (me), but overall, the pie was wonderful!
Everyone wanted more and more~
Loved it warm. It's close to the taste of my favorite pecan pie from Picadilly cafeteria.

Made this by the book and it turned out perfect! I did however spend hours on the internet trying to figure out how many caramel bit I needed instead of the squares ! I couldn't find caramel squares. but it turned out perfect! and I served with reddiwhip and vanilla ice cream. Question for the holder of this recipe since I am now back in the uk what is a substitute for caramels I used Kraft in the US but here in UK I don't have a clue what to substitute with can you help please.
just a little sweeter than I like, next time I will cut some sugar out...Others loved it the way it was.

The pie was very good but my filling was runny at room temperature. After refrigerating it set up. After reading reviews I didn't count the caramels that I used so I'm guessing that was my problem, which is my fault. But I will make this again, it was a great tasting pie!!!
Best.pie.ever!! Family raved about it during Thanksgiving

Nope, the top was beautiful and my crust was flaky buttery goodness. Yet when I cut into it the next day the middle oozed out all over. Maybe if I'd planned on serving it with ice cream and used the center of the pie as a caramel topping....
Made this for Thanksgiving and everyone loved it!! I followed the recipe to a tee but used about a cup and a half of pecans. This will be my go to pie for holiday desserts! Delicious!
I made this today for Thanksgiving exactly as written and it was excellent. Very rich and you can certainly taste the caramel.
This was a HUGE hit for Thanksgiving! It was a bit gooey, and therefore messy, but it was devoured anyway! VERY rich, so beware. :)
I was asked to make a pecan pie one year. I made this one instead of a basic pecan pie. It was an instant family hit. I've had to make it for the last three years maybe it's too good hahahahaha
Instant hit. I haven't been able to get away with not making it since then. haha maybe it's too good. Great recipe
Everyone loved the pie! Some comments where "That's better than grandma's"
Wow. This is a keeper. I doubled the recipe, used a bag and a half of the Kraft Carmel bits so I didn't have to unwrap candy, used only brown sugar and extra pecans. This is an amazing recipe.

Tried this recipe twice and couldn't make it work. Very runny both times. Used caramel chips that someone recommended to avoid the unwrapping and think/guess/wonder if that was my downfall. Gave it 3 stars because I think yours truly was the reason for the issue. Overall very well rated. Make a decent regular pecan pie so may stick with that although I take these things as a personal challenge sometimes to either fix it properly or adjust it to my liking.
So easy. I always get so many compliments. My young daughters enjoy making this as well. Delicious

Hubby LOVED it and surprisingly so did I! The only changes I made was used brown sugar instead of white and decreased the pecans to 3/4 cups. DH doesn't like a lot of pecans. He has already ask me to bake him one by New Years. Definitely will put this in my favs. Thanks so much for sharing!

My husband loved this pie!! I used a deep dish pie crust, and a bag of caramel baking pellets instead of wrapped caramels. I used brown sugar, and reduced it to 1/3 cup, although I may not use sugar at all next time since I think it would be sweet enough with just the caramel. I also used 2 cups of pecans, a mixture of pecan "cookie pieces" and chopped pecans. I will definitely make this again!

My brother-in-law won't let me in my sister's house for holidays until I show him this pie through the peephole. It's very good, ignore the naysayers. I tried the ice cream topping caramel and personally found it to be inferior to the wrapped caramels. It's not that hard, just open them and slowly melt them, it's worth it. Let the mixture cool a bit before adding it in unless you want scrambled eggs in your pie. I boost the amount of pecans a bit and add an airline mini-bottle of Gran Marnier to take it over the top. Don't over bake it.
A favorite. Everyone loved this pie.
Amazing. My father in law said its the best he's ever had!
Best pie I've ever made. Unbelievable. I lessened the sugar to 1/2 cup and added 1/4 cup of Kahlua. Sooooo good!

For Thanksgiving I had to make the dessert and my family requested a pecan pie. I don't normally like pecan pie, so I did a lot of searching and found this recipe. It was awesome! I actually loved it, and so did the family. The only change I made was that I topped it with hot fudge and topped that with some flaky sea salt. It was like a huge turtle pie. Delicious!!

I made this pie for Thanksgiving day and it was a really big hit. I will definitely make it again. I did do one extra step. After making the Carmel mixture I pored a little in the pie crust and swirled to cover the bottom. Family members are still talking about it.

I stumbled upon this recipe when I was researching pecan pie recipes to make for thanksgiving. I used to work in a bakery, and they sold the best pecan pie. I knew it had caramel melted into the filling, so I used that as my guide to choosing a recipe. This one certainly did not disappoint! I think it tasted almost exactly like the bakery one I missed, only perhaps with more caramel? I might reduce the amount next time to 28 caramels, as that was suggested in a few of the other recipes I looked at. The only change I made was to add extra pecans, as they are my favorite and one cup was not enough. I probably used more like 1 1/4 cups, and then added a bunch of halves to decorate the top with. This pie received rave reviews this thanksgiving...everyone adored it!
This has been my fav pecan pie recipe since i found it a couple years ago. This time i tried something different though. Fillo dough crust. Looks beautiful!
Delicious and easy.
This was an awesome, cavity-inducing dessert. Can't go wrong. We all loved it.

I have made nearly every pecan pie recipe out there and this is by and far the best. Wonderful texture, not at all that layer of corn syrup you find in every other pie and not so cloyingly sweet. Thanks so much for sharing this!!

I LOVE this recipe!! I am always asked by my sister to bring pecan pie for the holidays. (My sister LOVES pecan pie!) This year she said, bring pecan pie but don't put anything "strange" (she meant brandy) :) Anyway, that being said, I didn't tell her this had caramel in it although she loves caramel too. Well she Loved this. More surprising I was never a big fan of pecan pie as I found most of them so tooth jarringly sweet that I just couldn't come to like pecan pie. That is until this recipe! I did cut the sugar to 1/4 cup of white sugar and a 1/4 cup of brown sugar. I made 2 on 2 different days and both turned out PERFECTLY!!! Both baked at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. I used Werther's soft caramels and used 33 pieces (I couldn't find any of the Kraft caramels) but the Werther's worked great. I also cut the caramel to 33 pieces. I was surprised that some had bad luck with the pie being runny and not setting up or taking longer to bake. I always use an oven thermometer even though my oven has always been spot on for temperature (there's always a first time). Also, I find now days, the "large" eggs today are the small to medium eggs of "yesterday". I ALWAYS buy "jumbo" eggs in the super market, (but usually buy my eggs from people who have "backyard flocks" and these are ususaly heavy hens and lay BIG eggs). Possibly the runny pies that didn't set up were due to small eggs? To those people, I say get jumbo eggs and an oven thermometer! This recipe? AMAZING
This pie is perfect. Easy to make and always a hit.

I made this according to the recipe and I loved it. I have tweaked it to make it more *I think* worthy of a decadent christmas gift :) I substituted the caramel for dulche, white sugar for brown, AND the kicker, heavy table cream for milk. It's in the oven now and smells DIVINE!
I have now made this pie several times and we love it. I would watch your cooking time because it's easy to overcook this one. Definitely perfect for the holidays!

I made this pie for Thanksgiving and it was so delicious! I never made a pecan pie before but I love caramel and mixing it with the pecans was so tasty, it just melted in your mouth! Thank you for sharing such a wonderful recipe and I just might make one for Christmas too!
I've made this so often i no longer need the recipe..lol. it's an amazing pie!!!!
This is Reeeeediculously good! Perfection! Was a hit!
This was very good!

I was looking for a pie to serve on Thanksgiving along with the pumpkin and after reading a review that said they used Rolo's in place of the caramels, I decided to try it with that alteration. OMG Everyone who has tried it loved it. I was sooo very glad I made 2 (and will even admit to making a 3rd a week later). It will now be a staple for the holidays and I am going to try a mini version to add to tins of cookies and fudge that are my regular holiday gifts.

I made this pie for Thanksgiving and it was AMAZING!!! I followed others advice and used 1/2 cup sugar and 1 1/2 cups pecan halves that I chopped myself to make a little smaller. I used a package of caramel bites that don't need to be unwrapped and melted them with butter and milk as directed. I baked on convection for 45-50 mins, wrapped crust in foil to avoid burning and it was perfect. I've made pecan pies before with corn syrup and they never seemed to set right. Everyone loved it, even those who don't like pecan pie. I can't wait to make it again!!!!
I also used smuckers caramel. It was so easy to make :-)
